configuration.name: mc-item-022398373670876026
configuration.title: Animal Responses to Environmental Stimuli
configuration.stem: The turkey vulture, spider, and bat use different types of stimuli to find food. Match each animal with the type of stimulus the animal is responding to.

feedBack.firstWrongHint: Review the images and captions again.
feedBack.finalWrongHint: Turkey vultures use odor to find their food, spiders rely on motion in their webs to catch its prey, and bats use echolocation to hear and locate objects.

content.imageAlt: In this photograph, a turkey vulture stands on rocks at the shoreline.
This photograph shows a spider on a web.
